subject: Re: [junit] JUnit Anti-patterns
msgSnippet: The fact that Assert#assertEquals(Object,Object) makes it easy to accidentally compare two different implementations of java.util.Collection is more of a
messageBody:
The fact that Assert#assertEquals(Object,Object) makes it easy to
accidentally compare two different implementations of
java.util.Collection is more of a reflection upon the tester than the
testing API. :)
--
Stephen Smith, MEng (Wales).
http://www.stephen-smith.co.uk/

David Saff wrote:
> Stephen Smith wrote:
>> I'd suggest using Assert#assertEquals(String,Object,Object) to compare
>> two different java.util.Collection implementations (e.g. ArrayList,
>> Arrays.ArrayList) - but there's no real API-based solution to that one
>> unfortunately. If there's one comparison I tend to trip up on, it's
>> that. :(
>
> Can you give more details? What's the API you'd like to have, but
> don't? Thanks,
>
> David Saff
